1.text: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding give forth her voice?

2.text: On the top of high places by the way, at the cross-paths she taketh her stand.

3.text: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud.

4.text: Unto you, men, I call, and my voice is to the sons of man:

5.text: O ye simple, understand prudence; and ye foolish, understand sense.

6.text: Hear, for I will speak excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

7.text: For my palate shall meditate truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

8.text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing tortuous or perverse in them.

9.text: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold:

11.text: for wisdom is better than rubies, and all the things that may be desired are not equal to it.

12.text: I wisdom dwell [with] prudence, and find the knowledge [which cometh] of reflection.

13.text: The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil; pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth do I hate.

14.text: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am intelligence; I have strength.

15.text: By me kings reign, and rulers make just decrees;

16.text: by me princes rule, and nobles, all the judges of the earth.

17.text: I love those that love me; and they that seek me early shall find me.

18.text: Riches and honour are with me; durable wealth and righteousness.

19.text: My fruit is better than fine gold, yea, than pure gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

20.text: I walk in the path of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

21.text: that I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasuries.

22.text: Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

23.text: I was set up from eternity, from the beginning, before the earth was.

24.text: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no fountains abounding with water.

25.text: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth;

26.text: while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.

27.text: When he prepared the heavens I was there; when he ordained the circle upon the face of the deep;

28.text: when he established the skies above, when the fountains of the deep became strong;

29.text: when he imposed on the sea his decree that the waters should not pass his commandment, when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

30.text: then I was by him [his] nursling, and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

31.text: rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth, and my delights [were] with the sons of men.

32.text: And now, sons, hearken unto me, and blessed are they that keep my ways:

33.text: hear instruction and be wise, and refuse it not.

34.text: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

35.text: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and obtaineth favour of Jehovah;

36.text: but he that sinneth against me doeth violence to his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
